posts.post_content:
Posted By: AndyH
For the Holidays --

First to email me at andyhuntoon@gmail.com saying "I'll Take Them" gets them.  Better images are available [URL="http://picasaweb.google.com/andyhuntoon/BST#"]HERE[/URL].

$250.00 Delivered Priority with D/C.  I'm not breaking up the lot yet, I will post again if I am going to break it up.  Prefer Money Order or Cashier's Check, but will take personal check if I recognize you as a regular board contributor.  

T213-2 Ford, Buffalo Fed.

T213-2 Wilson, St. Louis Nat.

T213-2 Thomas, Philadelphia Amer. (skinned)

T213-2 Schaefer, Washington

T213-2 Canmitz, Pittsburgh Fed.

W516 George Burns

W516 Benny Kauf

W516 Geo. Bancroft (Dave) HOF

W516 Arty Fletcher

W516 Dick Rudolph

W516 Pep Young

W516 Edd Roush HOF

W516 Clyde Milan

W516 Ed Hooper (Harry) HOF

W516 Art Nehf

W520 Larry Doyle

W572 Jack Smith

W572 S. Johnson

T212-2 Chenault, Vancouver N.W.L

T212-2 Nelson, Oakland P.C.L.

T212-3 J. Ryan, Portland, P.C.L.

T206 Powers, Phila Amer.

T207 Severoid, Cinn. Nat. (trimmed)

E90-1 Tannehill, 3b, Chicago Nat'l

W515 Charlie Hollocher ("URE SERIES" on top)

M116 Spade ("UHLER CINC.N." has been typed at bottom by old collector, "Spade" in pencil on reverse)

E91-C Robt. Chech Boston

W519-1-1 Numbered Bob Veach

W519? Eddie Collins HOF

W519? Gabby Cravath (Gavvy)


None of these are in high grade.  This is a great collector lot.  Most have back damage, paperloss, etc.  See the link above for better images.  I didn't scan all the backs but if you need to see a back just let me know.


[IMG]http://www.network54.com/Realm/tmp/1228270723.JPG[/IMG] 


Thanks,

Andy
